Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> OK, I knew this was going to work, but WOW!! @michaeltoutjr and @John Westbrook you guys have worked together to make an awesome purchase experience! I used the VerusPay multi-coin QR code from my wallet home screen. Pointed it at the VerusPay mobile invoice, and one click later, I was done! Best crypto purchasing experience I've ever had.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Thanks Mike! The mobile wallet is incredibly fast and so accessible and easy to use, such a good user experience!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ethacetin> Can someone explain why the Verus monile wallet app wants permission to use the microphone on my phone (as well as a number of other permissions I don't understand such as controlling my phone and being able to access all my storage and write over it and it pleases)?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @michaeltoutjr can correct me if I'm wrong about anything. as I understand it, it needs storage because it stores data on your phone. I think that one is as simple as that. The audio/microphone is due to the QR code library used needing access to the video camera, which also includes the audio permission. It isn't used for anything by the app, and if you disable audio permission after it is installed it will still work. since it's open source, you can check the source if you have any real concerns

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <michaeltoutjr> @ethacetin Yep, the detailed descriptions of the permissions the app uses, and why it uses them are available at https://github.com/VerusCoin/Verus-Mobile/releases/tag/v0.1.3-beta under the "Permissions" header. Any other permissions stated as required in the install screen are either used for the above descriptions, related in some way to the above descriptions, or possibly added by react-native or gradle during building but never used. We're trying to sort those out before official release

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <ethacetin> Cool. Thanks a lot guys. I'll check that out. I love this project and have the highest hopes for it.
